page.title: 11MORE ABOUT OUR VILLAGE
page.content: Several years ago a fire swept from one thatched roof to the next and most of the village cottages were damaged. Some temporary prefab were built in the late 1940's for use by council tenants.This year the present tenants had to move out whilst the 'temporary'houses were completely refurbished. A new housing development provided the school with good clay excavated when concrete piles had to be sunk for house foundation support.This put a few extra pounds cash on each house. The Church dates from Anglo Saxon times and is an active influence in the village.The school children visit ,as classes, for church events. The bus service is rather sparse but sufficient for school children and workers on regular times.
